text:
Example: Binomial probability
Assuming a binomial distribution, compute the probability of drawing three black
beans from a bowl of black and white beans if the probability of selecting a black bean
in any given attempt is 0.6. You will draw five beans from the bowl.
Answer:
P(X = 3) = p(3) = 51, (0.69° (0.4)2 = (120 / 12)(0.216)(0.160) = 0.3456
